alert.note: Alert for Coastal Cumberland; Coastal York (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 28 at 3:16PM EST until March 01 at 4:00AM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...LOW PRESSURE TO BRING ACCUMULATING SNOW TO THE REGION THROUGH THIS EVENING... .An area of low pressure will exit the region tonight. Snow will taper off west to east before ending overnight. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM EST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations between 1 and 3 inches for a storm total of 5 to 8 inches. * WHERE...In Maine, Coastal Cumberland and Coastal York Counties. In New Hampshire, Belknap, Merrimack, and Interior Rockingham Counties. * WHEN...Until 4 AM EST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Even light snowfall amounts can accumulate on roads and cause dangerous driving conditions due to snow covered roads. The hazardous conditions will impact this evening`s commute.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by going to newengland511.org
